title: Identify a positron in nuclear reaction

content.question: In each of the nuclear reactions given below, a product is indicated by the letter X. In which of the reactions does the letter X represent a positron? (A positron is a positively charged particle with the same mass and magnitude of charge as an electron.)

choices.label: The known nuclei are represented with a superscripted and subscripted number in front of their symbol. 14 7 N plus 1 1 H react to form 15 8 Oplus X
The known nuclei are represented with a superscripted and subscripted number in front of their symbol. 15 8 O reacts to form 15 7 Nplus x plus nu
The known nuclei are represented with a superscripted and subscripted number in front of their symbol. 15 7 N plus 1 1 H react to form 12 6 Cplus X
The known nuclei are represented with a superscripted and subscripted number in front of their symbol. 12 6 C plus X react to form 13 7 Nplus gamma

content.answer: The known nuclei are represented with a superscripted and subscripted number in front of their symbol. 15 8 O reacts to form 15 7 Nplus x plus nu

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
